tasks.task: Managing rice quality for local consumption in Africa
subtasks: Avoid mixing rice varieties from sowing to milling. This involves separating different seed sources, planting in designated plots, and maintaining pure varieties.
Ensuring proper harvesting time. The right time is about five weeks after flowering or when 80% of the field changes color. This relates to the farmer checking the rice and deciding when to harvest.
Threshing and removing impurities. Threshing must be done on a clean floor (like tarpaulin) to avoid stones. Also, carefully winnow and check for remaining impurities.
Testing paddy dryness. Using hands and teeth to check if rice is properly dried without being over-dried.
Proper storage of paddy. Keep it elevated off the ground on dry wood, allowing air circulation and easy pest control.
